alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Ozark; Taney; Texas; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 1:39PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas, Ozark, Taney and Wright. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with additional heavy rain expected. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Spring Creek at County Road 349, North Fork River at County Road 278, Fox Creek at County Road 246, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Pond Fork at County Road 883 and Beaver Creek at County Road 524. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ava, Gainesville, Theodosia, Wasola, Sundown, Rockbridge, Brixey, Gentryville, Noble, Willhoit, Brushyknob, Zanoni, Squires, Drury, Sycamore, Vanzant, Thornfield, Hardenville, Dora, Isabella, Tecumseh, Long Run, Rome, Goodhope, Siloam Springs, Bull Shoals Lake, Norfork Lake and Bryant Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Howell; Ozark; Taney; Texas; Wright
